alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Vance, southwestern Warren, southern Granville, north central Wake, southeastern Durham and northwestern Franklin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Henderson to 7 miles northeast of Durham. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds 40 mph to 45 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may lead to localized flooding especially in poor drainage locations. Locations impacted include... Durham, Henderson, Creedmoor, Warrenton, Wake Forest, Butner, Franklinton, Norlina, Kittrell and Youngsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake; Warren
